component.name: RunPhyloGibbs
component.doc: This component runs PhyloGibbs with some hardcoded parameters. It tries to find five motifs, which all are returned in the output. Also logos are produced for all of the motifs.

input.name: infile
input.doc: Typically even half of Alignments or Sequences from SplitAlignments.

output.name: WeightMatrix1
output.doc: This is the weight matrix of the motif that phylogibbs found.

output.name: WeightMatrix2
output.doc: This is the weight matrix of the motif that phylogibbs found.

output.name: intermediate
output.doc: Directory for intermediate files. Might be empty after running this component.

parameter.name: mylogo_path
parameter.doc: Path to mylogo logo creation script.

parameter.name: markovorder
parameter.doc: Markov order of background model. 0 is bg base probability estimated from base counts in the input data. -1 is 0.25 each.

parameter.name: numberWindows
parameter.doc: The number of windows that are allowed to be placed. -1 is default, which means that this number if a function of the number of input alignments/sequences given (num=0.7*input_alns). If a positive number is given here, it will be used instead.

parameter.name: numberColours
parameter.doc: The number of different colours or motives. This mustn't be smaller than 2. If this number is greater than 2, just the first two motifs get reported!

parameter.name: AlignmentOrder
parameter.doc: How alignments should be treated: 0=no alignments are assumed, 1=only species are taken into account that are gaplessly aligned to the reference, 2=no windows are put at positions where any of the species has a gap.
